Metaverse Scam Unraveled: Las Vegas Resident Charged In $45 Million Fraud Scheme
entry.summary:
In a major development, federal prosecutors have unveiled charges against Bryan Lee, a resident of Las Vegas, as part of an ongoing investigation into an alleged cryptocurrency and Metaverse scam. The intricate fraud, known as the CoinDeal scam, allegedly duped over 10,000 investors by enticing them with promises of astronomical returns totaling one trillion dollars.
The Deceptive CoinDeal Scheme
The indictment against Bryan Lee sheds light on his collaboration with three other individuals to orchestrate the CoinDeal investment fraud. Under the guise of developing virtual reality products within a legitimate family of businesses, Lee and his co-conspirators lured investors with the prospect of their crypto token tied to a fictitious Metaverse project.
They further amplified their ‚Ä¶

Marathon pledged to match all contributions toward this cause, totaling a maximum of $500,000 through 2023.
Bitcoin Mining Firm Marathon Partners with Brink to Generate $1 Million for Bitcoin Core Development
The publicly-traded mining infrastructure corporation Marathon Digital Holdings (Nasdaq: MARA) announced its partnership with the 501(c)(3) nonprofit Brink to raise funds for Bitcoin Core developers. In a statement on Thursday, Marathon explained, ‚ÄúThese developers are volunteers, who often work pro bono or on a donation basis, to ensure the Bitcoin pro‚Ä¶

entry.title: ‚ÄòBig Short‚Äô Author Michael Lewis On The Financial Crisis, FTX And Bitcoin‚Äôs Freedom From Intermediaries
entry.summary: Best-selling author and journalist Michael Lewis, known for writing ‚ÄúThe Big Short,‚Äù ‚ÄúMoneyball‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Blind Side,‚Äù offered his perspective on the current financial landscape and the rapidly-changing world of cryptocurrency on stage today at Bitcoin 2023. ‚ÄúWhen I first encountered the idea of being able to use the blockchain technology to disintermediate financial intermediaries, I thought, ‚Äòthank God,‚Äô‚Äù Lewis said of his realizations when first researching Bitcoin. ‚ÄúThere are lots of unnecessary hands touching money when financial transactions occur. They've just been kind of hard baked into the system.‚Äù As the author of ‚ÄúThe Big Short,‚Äù Lewis outlined the fundamental inequalities and short-sighted policies of the contemporary financial system that led to the economic crisis of 2007 an‚Ä¶

entry.title: Speaking At Bitcoin 2023, Tulsi Gabbard Describes How A U.S. CBDC Threatens Freedom
entry.summary: Former congresswoman and presidential candidate Tulsi Gabbard addressed the audience at Bitcoin 2023 today, focusing on the institutional problems with U.S. politics and elected leaders who seek to consolidate power rather than serve constituents. ‚ÄúI served in Congress for eight years and ran for president in 2020, and while we like to have this idea that we have great courageous leaders in Washington ‚Ä¶ unfortunately, that‚Äôs not the case,‚Äù Gabbard said. ‚ÄúUltimately, they‚Äôre driven by a fear of losing power and losing control and, at the heart of it, they‚Äôre afraid of us. They‚Äôre afraid of a free society.‚Äù In particular, she highlighted the Biden administration‚Äôs exploration of a central bank digital currency (CBDC), underscoring how such a project would be antithetical to the privacy- and freedom-preserving qualities of cash transactions. As outlined in its white paper by Satoshi Nakamoto, ‚ÄúBitcoin: A Peer-To-Peer Electronic Cash System,‚Äù Bitcoin was designed to preserve these qualities in a digital way. ‚ÄúThe Biden administration‚Äôs move toward implementing a central bank digital currency is their latest effort towards exerting control and taking away our freedom,‚Äù Gabbard said. ‚ÄúNo matter how many flowery words they use to deny that there is ill intent‚Ä¶ no matter how many times they say, ‚ÄòHey this is for your own good‚Äô... But ultimately, we know this is about their insatiable mission and desire for total control.‚Äù She also suggested that those in power are combative toward or disinterested in Bitcoin because it cannot be manipulated by any third parties. ‚ÄúYou would think they would be interested in how Bitcoin is transforming the lives of people around the world, but they don‚Äôt actually care about people,‚Äù she said.

entry.title: Miami International Completes $50M Takeover of LedgerX from FTX
entry.summary: Miami International Holdings (MIH), a US-based exchange conglomerate, has finalized its $50 million acquisition of LedgerX from the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange FTX and its debtors. LedgerX, one of the few solvent subsidiaries of FTX Founder Samuel Bankman-Fried‚Äôs former empire, is a crypto derivatives platform. MIH Rounds Off LedgerX Purchase FTX and its debtors last month announced sales of LedgerX to M7 Holdings, an affiliate of MIH. In the aftermath of FTX‚Äôs collapse in November last year, FTX sought permission to sell LedgerX and three other subsidiaries: FTX Japan, FTX Europe and Embed, a stock-clearing platform. The bankrupt crypto exchange secured the permission to sell LedgerX and the other subsidiaries in January. Although the four subsidiaries ‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
Cardano (ADA) Founder, Charles Hoskinson, has taken to Twitter to claim that Ethereum Classic (ETC) is now a ‚Äúscam‚Äù and has no ‚Äúpurpose other than to allow insiders to dump their holdings‚Äù on unsuspecting investors. Hoskinson, who previously worked with ETC, stated that the project has ‚Äúno roadmap, innovation, team, or vision‚Äù, and is only filled with ‚Äúanger and toxicity‚Äù.
Cardano Founder Backs Ethical Alternative To Scam Operation
Hoskinson‚Äôs comments were made in response to a Twitter post by the Proof of Work (POW) Summit and have raised eyebrows in the cryptocurrency community. Many have questioned the timing of Hoskinson‚Äôs comments, as ETC has recently seen a surge in price and popularity.¬†
ETC is now a scam and it's only purpose is for insiders to dump on those they recruit‚Ä¶

entry.title: FATF President Urges G7 to Lead in Shutting Down ‚ÄòLawless Crypto Space‚Äô
entry.summary:
It is necessary to put an ‚Äúend to the lawless crypto space,‚Äù according to the head of the Financial Action Task Force (FATF). G7 nations must set an example in implementing global standards on combating money laundering, the executive insisted, as little progress has been made in regards to introducing the organization‚Äôs new crypto rules.
Crypto Assets Continue to Operate in Lawless Global Environment, FATF Chief Says
The Group of Seven (G7) must lead in implementing recommendations on combating money laundering, terrorism and proliferation financing, FATF President T. Raja Kumar urged ahead of the developed economies‚Äô summit in Hiroshima, Japan, this weekend.
Countries have advanced with introducing most of the FATF standards but progress on implementing the updated requirements co‚Ä¶

entry.title: Gary Vee Discusses VeeCon 2023's Broader Shift Beyond Web3

entry.title: Gary Vee on the NFT Market and Why 'NFTs Are Stuffed Animals'

He joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward amid VeeCon 2023 to discuss why he thinks the NFT space will be comparable to collectible sports cards, art, and even stuffed animals.

entry.title: US Prosecutors Charge New Suspect in $45M Blockchain Fraud ‚ÄòCoinDeal‚Äô
entry.summary: US prosecutors have filed a lawsuit against a new suspect, Bryan Lee, 57, for his alleged involvement in ‚ÄòCoinDeal‚Äô, a fraudulent investment scheme that raised $45 million by selling unregistered securities. Neil Chandran, the mastermind behind the scheme, was arrested in June last year and indicted for wire fraud and monetary transaction in unlawful proceeds. Despite a similar brand, the scheme has no connection with CoinDeal, a St. Vincent and Grenadines-based crypto exchange run by Adam Bicz and Kajetan Maƒákowiak. SEC Arraigns ‚ÄòCoinDeal‚Äô Promoters Earlier in January, the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) charged Chandran and four other individuals for their involvement in the scheme. The securities regulator named the individuals as Garry Davidson, Michael ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Microbt Unveils New Whatsminer Bitcoin Mining Rig With 320 TH/s, Setting New Standard for Hashpower
entry.summary:
During the Bitcoin 2023 conference in Miami, bitcoin mining rig producer Microbt unveiled three new additions to their Whatsminer series. The latest Whatsminer models, namely the M50S++, M53S++, and M56S++, boast hashpower ranging from 150 terahash per second (TH/s) to an impressive 320 TH/s.
Microbt Introduces Cutting-Edge Whatsminer Models at Bitcoin 2023
This week at Miami‚Äôs Bitcoin 2023 event, Microbt introduced three distinct application-specific integrated circuit (ASIC) bitcoin mining devices. ‚ÄúMicrobt is glad to release three new models of Whatsminer M50 series at Bitcoin 2023 which are air-cooling M50S++, hydro-cooling M53S++ and immersion cooling M56S++,‚Äù the company tweeted on May 18. Micorobt‚Äôs three new miners are expected to be released to the general public this month. ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ripple‚Äôs Case: Lawyer Predicts Total Victory If Judge Agrees To Jury Decision
entry.summary:
In recent months, the legal battle between Ripple Labs and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has garnered significant attention in cryptocurrency. The SEC alleges that the company distributed 14.6 billion units of XRP without registering it as a security and has sued the company and its executives for this alleged violation.
However, the case is far from straightforward. Many legal arguments are being made on both sides, and it is difficult to determine who will come out on top. Pro-XRP lawyer John Deaton has pointed out that the parties have not yet filed their 56.1 statements and counter statements, which will contain indisputable facts and evidence supporting their positions for summary judgment. This means that making any definitive conclusions about the case is prema‚Ä¶

entry.title: Problems With Being an 'On-Chain Purist' in Gaming
entry.summary: InfiniGods Cofounders Owen O'Donoghue and Damon Gura keep it real with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, sharing thoughts on game balancing and what to do when in-game assets become NFTs.

entry.title: Why Solana Won't Become A Web3 Game Publisher
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's Games General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Solana's "build together" approach as well as his thoughts on crypto firms becoming game publishers.

entry.title: The State Of Web3 Gaming On Hedera
entry.summary: Hedera VP Alex Russman tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Hedera's Web3 gaming ecosystem and shares a game he's particularly excited about.

entry.title: How Mirandus is Innovating Video Game Audio
entry.summary: Mirandus' Lead Developer and Gala Games Cofounder Michael McCarthy tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game's thoughtful approach to audio design and the technologies being built to support the MMORPG's immersive world.

entry.title: Do Gamers Hate NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks the InfiniGods developers Damon Gura and Owen O‚ÄôDonoghue about gamers and NFTs.

entry.title: gm: Avenged Sevenfold's M. Shadows on Deathbats, Fandom, and AI
entry.summary: Avenged Sevenfold lead singer Matt Sanders, aka M. Shadows, is rehearsing for the band's upcoming tour. He's also figuring out how to upend what it means to be a music fan. The band launched a Deathbats Club NFT collection in 2021. That is to say: They were early. The lead singer said it was timed to give fans a chance to get comfortable with Web3 technology ahead of the group's 2023 tour, when the NFT holders can use their Deathbats for early access to tickets. M. Shadows also talked to hosts Andrew Hayward and Stephen Graves about AI and bringing Web3 into gaming.

entry.title: Inside Mojo Melee's Lore with Creator Mike Levine and Art Director Eric Campanella
entry.summary: At the Game Developers' Conference, Mojo Melee Creator Mike Levine and Art Director Eric Campanella tell Decrypt's Kate Irwin about their autobattler game and its unique characters, which are also NFTs on Polygon.

entry.title: Why 'Blair Witch' Exec Producer Kevin Foxe Is '1,000% In' on Gaming
entry.summary: "The Blair Witch Project" Executive Producer Kevin Foxe wants to avoid corporate overlords and enlighten fans of the dark "Mandala" graphic novel with a video game adaptation and NFTs across multiple blockchains.

entry.title: Gala Games Co-Founder on the Aesthetic of Mirandus
entry.summary: "When assets are overdone, they just feel a little dirty. It's not pretty to look at," shared Mirandus' Lead Developer and Gala Games co-founder Michael McCarthy in an interview with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Solana Games GM: Play-to-Earn Games Are DeFi Products, Not Games
entry.summary: Solana Games' General Manager Johnny Lee offers a hot take on the first generation of Web3 gaming with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Brycent's Advice For Gaming Content Creators
entry.summary: XSET's Brycent shares his advice for Web3 content creators with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, including which social media platform is best for posting content.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes of Jeremy Cowart's 'Auras' NFT Event
entry.summary: A look at the preparation behind "Auras," an event in which photographer Jeremy Cowart produced and starred in 10,000 photo-based NFTs, captured in less than 30 minutes before a live audience. Credit: Brett Carlsen for Decrypt

entry.title: Jeremy Cowart Discusses 'Auras' Event, Live-Shooting 10,000 Photo NFTs
entry.summary: Jeremy Cowart speaks with Decrypt's Sander Lutz in Nashville ahead of the "Auras" event, in which the noted photographer live-shot 10,000 unique photo-based NFTs in less than 30 minutes. The NFTs will be released through OpenSea on May 9. Video credit: Brett Carlsen for Decrypt

entry.title: Azra Games CEO on Putting Fun Before Web3
entry.summary: "The Web3 interfaces cannot be on the foreground of the player's initial experience," says Azra Games CEO Mark Otero.

entry.title: gm: Meet Immunefi's White Hat Whisperer
entry.summary: When Web3 bug bounty platform Immunefi launched two years ago, CEO and founder Mitchell Amador says the bug bounties weren't great and adoption was slow. But the tides started to turn because even if exploiting a smart contract nets a bigger payday than a bounty, it comes with a huge drawback. "There's a ton of risk when you engage in this, you know, wantonly criminal behavior and steal $200 million from someone else," he said. "There's no way someone's not going to come looking."
